messageBody:
Erik Meade wrote:
>
> David,
>
> I think your right. I have seen a redirection servlet which gets passed
> a testid and url. The testid is used to populate the MockBeans which is
> then sent to the url (JSP).

I'm not sure I understand what you've described. I'm growing a
framework for testing JSPs by just calling them locally. But, how do
you get the JSP-compiled code to use the right (mock) class? The only
way I can see, is to completely avoid the <usebean> functionality, and
roll your own equivalent code which is "mock-aware".


>
> --

> > is likely to make it difficult to unitTest the JSP. That is, what I
> > want to make the beans be MockBeans. Can anyone here make any useful
